required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of IONIS-HTTRx in Patients With Early Manifest Huntington's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Multiple Ascending Doses of Intrathecally Administered ISIS 443139 in Patients With Early Manifest Huntington's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of multiple ascending doses of IONIS-HTTRx administered intrathecally to adult patients with early manifest Huntington's Disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety (The number of participants with adverse events)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of the study; an expected 29 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with adverse events

primary_outcome.measure: Tolerability (The number of participants with adverse events)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of the study; an expected 29 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: CSF Pharmacokinetics (The observed CSF drug concentration)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, and Day 113 or Day 141

other_outcome.measure: Time to peak ISIS 443139 plasma concentration, Tmax (hours)

other_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, and Day 113 or Day 141
Day 1, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, and Day 113 or Day 141

other_outcome.measure: Huntington's disease cognitive assessment battery composite score (unitless)
other_outcome.time_frame: Screening, Day -1, Day 84, Day 141, and Day 197

arm_group.description: IONIS HTTRx is administered intrathecally at 4 week intervals over the course of a 13 week treatment period for dose levels A, B, C, D and E.
A placebo is administered intrathecally at 4 week intervals over the course of 13 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with early manifest Huntington's disease
- Male or female, aged 25 to 65 years, inclusive, at the time of informed consent
- Able and willing to meet all study requirements, including travel to Study Center and participation in all procedures and measurements at study visits
- Have a trial partner who is reliable, competent and at least 18 years of age, is willing to accompany the patient to select trial visits and to be available to the Study Center by phone if needed
- Able to tolerate MRI scans, blood draws and lumbar punctures
- Reside within 4 hours travel of the Study Center
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant medical condition, such as severe chorea, active suicidal ideation or any other conditions which would make the patient unsuitable for inclusion or could interfere with the patient participating in or completing the study
- Recent treatment with another investigational drug, biological agent, or device
- Prior treatment with an antisense oligonucleotide (including siRNA)
- Any history of gene therapy or cell transplantation or any other experimental brain surgery
- Presence of an implanted shunt for the drainage of CSF or an implanted CNS catheter
- History of post-lumbar-puncture headache of moderate or severe intensity and/or blood patch
- Malignancy within 5 years of Screening, except for basal or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin or carcinoma in situ of the cervix that has been successfully treated
- Hospitalization for any major medical or surgical procedure involving general anesthesia within 12 weeks of Screening or planned during the study

facility.name: University of Manchester, St. Mary's Hospital
